name: coR-ge
tagline: Software for the Examination of Multiple Correction Methodologies in Accurate Genomic Environments
body:
## Quick-start Guide.

Welcome to the landing page for **coR-ge** (**cor**ection of **ge**nomes in **R**). This software is in active development, and pull requests are welcome on any of the branches. Please find below instructions for use cases. For more complex use, please contact the maintainer by [raising an issue](https://github.com/Chris1221/sFDR/issues/new) on the project repository.

This project was presented at the High Powered Computer Symposium in June 2015. The [abstract](https://github.com/Chris1221) and [poster PDF](https://github.com/Chris1221) are also found in the repository. 

### Program Structure

Heuristically, **coR-ge** is structured as follows.  


![Logic Flow](http://puu.sh/iivgo/9682715306.png)

In reality, these three steps are divided into different files in the repository.  The quick start guide will nonetheless follow this logic flow in order to simplify matters.   

### Installation
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
